{"step_by_step_thinking": "The radiopacity that frequently obliterates the root apices of maxillary molars is likely to be a structure that is anatomically close to these teeth. The maxillary sinus is located in the upper jaw, right above the roots of the maxillary molars. The palatine bone, zygoma and zygomatic process of maxilla, and orbital process of zygomatic bone are not as closely related to the roots of the maxillary molars as the maxillary sinus is.", "answer_choice": "A. Maxillary sinus"}
